content: the design for a personal touch 🧷 assembly ● before attaching the icing make sure the top of the white icing strip aligns with the top of the bun base ● use the white yarn tail to sew the icing piece in place attachment tip you can 1 sew the icing on first making sure to insert your needle underneath the icing when attaching the roll or 2 attach the roll first then layer and sew the icing on top using the light brown tail apply a running stitch around the outer edge of the roll to secure it 13 🍩 donut with color e light brown 🧵 donut base ● round 1 chain 12 slip_stitch into first chain to form a ring 12 chains ● round 2 chain 2 double_crochet increase in each st around join with a slip_stitch 24 sts ● round 3 chain 1 s c in next 3 sts increase in next st ×4 d c in next st double_crochet increase in next st ×4 join with a slip_stitch 32 sts fo and leave a tail for attaching to the background 🍩 icing with color g pink ● round 1 chain 12 slip_stitch into first chain to form a ring 12 chains ● round 2 chain 2 double_crochet increase in each st around join with a slip_stitch 24 sts ● round 3 chain 1 s c in next 3 sts increase in next st repeat around join with a slip_stitch 30 sts fo and leave a long tail for sewing ✨ optional embroidery use yarn scraps to stitch sprinkles onto the icing ● use any colors you like bright rainbow colors work great ● vary your stitch direction and length for a whimsical playful effect 🧷 assembly before attaching make sure the donut and icing holes align the double_crochet stitches from round 3 of the donut base should be the bottom of your donut and not covered by the icing 14 ● use the pink tail to sew the icing onto the donut base ● then using the light brown tail attach the donut to your background using a running stitch ● stitch around the outer edge and the inner hole making sure to tuck your stitches under the icing layer for a clean finish attachment tip you can also attach the donut first and then sew the icing on top whichever feels easiest to manage 🔤 letters using color b brown ✏ c ● chain 9 ● increase in second chain from hook and in each chain across 16 sts ● fo and leave a tail for attaching ✏ o ● chain 10 slip_stitch to first chain to form a ring ● single_crochet in next st increase in next st repeat around ● slip_stitch to join ● fo and leave a tail for attaching 15 ✏ t ● chain 9 single_crochet in second chain from hook and across 8 sts ● chain 4 single_crochet in second chain from hook and in next 2 chain ●
